reviewText: Though this is a 50's black and white and not up to modern clarity and technology it was great fun to relive the past with these talented actors.

I love this set. I'm a big fan and collector of old black n white
movies and tv shows. This collection is rare tv probably never seen
or only seen once. Its way before my time but I love old gangsters
action type films. Theres many familiar faces the notable is Lee
Marvin and Simon Oakland who's really good as a mob boss. He should've
had more roles. If you like good old fashion tv and film noir you'll
love this. Too bad there aren't more sets released.

Specialists in niche market material such as vintage programmers and TV shows, Pennsylvania-based ALPHA VIDEO is owned by Jerry Greene, founder of Collectable Records. Quality of their unrestored movie transfers varies from fair to good, based on condition of source material stock (often old 16mm broadcast prints). The only extras provided are a catalog insert and DVD-accessible title list. ALPHA's unusual collection of TV crime drama rarities includes several unsold pilot episodes and the first television appearance of Roy Thinnes (later of THE INVADERS). Lee Marvin is seen in his debut series. 3 Stooges foil Vernon Dent appears with Marvin, as does Patty Duke's TV dad, Bill Schallert. Fred Waring (of the Pennsylvanians) hosts a sample episode of an unrealized firefighter show. PROGRAM-- VOLUME ONE The Shadow: "The Case of the Cotton Kimono" (pilot-1954) - Tom Helmore/Paula Raymond/Alexander Scourby Unsolved: (pilot-1960) - Simon Oakland/Joe De Santis/Lisa Gaye/Richard Karlin/Dabbs Greer Cavalcade of America: "Chicago 2-1-2" (4/30/57) - Frank Lovejoy/Roy Thinnes/Franklyn MacCormack The Bogus Green (pilot-1951) - Preston Foster/Martha Vickers/Don Beddoe VOLUME TWO Boston Blackie: The Motorcycle Kid" (4/3/53) - Kenneth Taylor/ Frank Orth/Lois Collier/Sandy Sanders Alarm (pilot-1956) - Fred Waring/John Hoyt/Dorothy Green/John Hubbard/Wright King/Herb Vigran Mandrake the Magician: (pilot-1954) - Coe Norton/Woody Strode/Lisa Howard/Carl Frank Rebound (aka Counterpoint): "The Witness" (5/16/52) - Lee Marvin/William Schallert/Vera Marshe/Vernon Dent Front Page Detective: "Seven Seas To Danger" (1952) - Edmund Lowe/Paula Drew/George Pembroke
